div.p:
Published by:
U.S. Office of the National Coordinator (ONC)

This profile defines the expected capabilities of the DAF Responder actor when conforming to the DAF-Core IG. The statement includes the complete list of actual profiles, RESTful operations, search parameters supported by DAF Responders. DAF Requesters have the option of choosing from this list to access necessary data based on their local use cases and other contextual requirements.

The DAF Responder SHALL support the DAF-core-patient resource profile. In addition to the DAF-core-patient, the DAF Responder SHALL support at least one additional resource profile from the list of DAF-Core profiles. The DAF Responder SHALL implement REST behavior according to the FHIR specification. The DAF Responder SHALL support both json and xml resource formats for all DAF interactions. The DAF Responder SHALL identify the DAF profile(s) supported as part of the FHIR BaseResource.Meta.profile attribute for each instance. The DAF Responder SHALL declare a Capability statement and identify the list of profiles, operations, search parameter supported.
DAF Responders SHALL meet the security requirements documented in the DAF-Core Security requirements..

a.title: Allows discovery of DAF-core-patient resources based on different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific DAF-core-patient by resource id
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a DAF-core-patient
Allows review of changes to DAF-core-patient over time
Allows discovery of DAF-core-allergyintolerance resources based on different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific DAF-core-allergyintolerance by id

div.p: DAF Responders SHALL support the following common parameters as part of queries related to DAF-Core profiles:
DAF Responders SHALL support the following search contexts defined within the FHIRspecification.

ul.li: Search context by specifying a particular resource type

div.p: DAF Responders SHALL support Modifiers as applicable to the data types of the search parameters. DAF Responders SHALL also support Composite Search Parameters as defined in the FHIR specification.

ul.li: id - Search based on resource id ( string)
identifier - Search based on patient identifier ( token)
name and gender- Search based on given name or family name or text name and gender.
family and gender- Search based on family name and gender.
given and gender- Search based on given name and gender.
name and birthdate- Search based on given name or family name or text name and birthdate.
patient - Search allergies for a patient( reference)
patient and category - Search for CarePlan by patient and category
patient and category and status - Search for CarePlan by patient and category and status
patient and category and date - Search for CarePlan by patient and category and one or more dates
patient and category and status and date - Search for CarePlan by patient and category and status and one or more dates
patient and category and status - Search for CareTeam by patient and category and status
patient and category - Search for Condition by patient and category
patient and clinicalstatus - Search for Condition by patient and clinicalstatus
patient - Search Devices for a patient( reference)
patient and date - Search for Goals by patient and one or more dates
patient - Search for Immunizations by patient (reference)
patient and code - Search for DiagnosticReport by patient and code
patient and category - Search for DiagnosticReport by patient and category
patient and category and date - Search for DiagnosticReport by patient and category and one or more dates
patient and category and code date - Search for DiagnosticReport by patient and category and code and one or more dates
patient and code - Search for Observation by patient and code
patient and category - Search for Observation by patient and category
patient and category and date - Search for Observation by patient and category and one or more dates
patient and category and code and date - Search for Observation by patient and category and code and one or more dates
None
None
patient - Search MedicationStatement for a patient( reference)
patient - Search MedicationRequest for a patient( reference)
patient and code - Search for Observation (SmokingStatus) by patient and code
patient and code - Search for Observation (Vital Signs) by patient and code
patient and category - Search for Observation (Vital Signs) by patient and category
patient and category and date - Search for Observation (Vital Signs) by patient and category and one or more dates
patient and code and date - Search for Observation (Vital Signs) by patient and code and one or more dates
None
None
patient and date - Search for Procedure by patient and date

div.p: DAF Responders SHALL support Patient/$everything operation to return data for all the DAF-core profiles they support.

publisher.value: U.S. Office of the National Coordinator (ONC)

description.value: This profile defines the expected capabilities of the DAF Responder actor when conforming to the DAF-Core IG.

documentation.value: The DAF Responder SHALL support the DAF-core-patient resource profile. In addition to the DAF-core-patient, the DAF Responder SHALL support at least one additional resource profile from the list of DAF profiles. The DAF Responder SHALL implement REST behavior according to the FHIR specification. The DAF Responder SHALL support both json and xml resource formats for all DAF interactions.

description.value: DAF Responders SHALL implement the security requirements documented in the DAF-Core IG.
